intro: Palicourea rigida var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant features opposite, elliptic to lanceolate leaves that are usually glabrous and have a leathery texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals with prominent yellow stamens. This variety is often found in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests.
